Best fitness bracelet Fitness bracelets are finding it hard to pick favorites as the market now has a large number of devices that are similar in accuracy and overlap with each other. Following our top favorites. Best Allrounder Fitness Bracelet: Fitbit Charge 2 ( our Charge 2 Review )The successor to the popular Charge HR has been significantly improved in many places and equipped with additional features. Highlights include built-in heart rate monitoring, cardio fitness level features and various sports profiles. For runners are also suitable options: if necessary, the GPS of the smartphone can be used and thus distance, speed and average speed recorded. Furthermore, the batch offers 2 movement reminders, smartphone notifications and removable wristbands. Best fitness bracelet for runners : Garmin Vivosmart HR + ( our Vivosmart HR + Review )The waterproof Vivosmart HR + has an integrated heart rate monitor, a GPS receiver, Move IQ for automatic activity detection and advanced running features. A virtual pacer and run / walk timer completes the advanced running features. In addition, a floor counter is installed. The Vivosmart HR + also offers a 24 × 7 activity tracker (heart rate, sleep, steps, calories, distance, floors and daily goals) and can forward via ANT + the data of the pulse sensor to compatible devices, such as cycling computers. It supports smartphone notifications such as incoming calls, various messages and calendar entries of the smartphone. The software (webplatform and app) is very good.Best Fitness Bracelet Heart Rate Workouts (also for runners) : Polar A370 ( our A370 Review)The A370 is especially good at measuring your pulse during workouts, especially when running. For the training mode, he offers many sports profiles. He also masters fully automatic sleep analysis, the recording of steps, calories, distances and daily goals. In addition, the A370 can also use the GPS receiver of the smartphone for track recording and 24/7 measure the pulse. For runners, the new option of transferring individual running programs from Polar Flow to the fitness bracelet is even more interesting, in order to specifically prepare for a competition. It also supports smartphone notifications such as incoming calls, various messages and calendar entries on the smartphone. Another highlight is the high-resolution color display with support for typing and swiping gestures.Best Fitness Bracelet Value for Money : Huawei Band 2 Pro (Our Huawei Band 2 Pro Review )Especially with the price the Huawei Band 2 Pro is unbeatable. Because it brings many highlights for the small budget with: include an integrated 24/7 pulse sensor, of course, an activity tracker for recording steps, distances, calorie consumption and sleep. Furthermore, it is waterproof and suitable for swimming. An integrated GPS receiver records running distances and records speed, movement and distance. The creation of individual or pre-defined training plans to prepare for competitions (5 km, half marathon, marathon, ...) is possible and an added value.Best Fitness Bracelet Style & Features : Fitbit Versa ( our Fitbit Versa Review )The Fitbit Versa is one of Fitbit's most advanced trackers and offers loads of features for health-conscious people. Including a color touch screen, about 300 songs large, local memory, smartphone notifications, a waterproof housing, female health tracking (eg cycle-capture) and much more. Unfortunately, integrated GPS is not included, but the GPS of the smartphone can be used for this.Fitness bracelet for strength athletes : Garmin Vivosmart 3 ( our Vivosmart 3 Review )The Vivosmart 3 also convinces as a basic fitness wristband. In addition to 24 × 7 activity recording (steps, calories, distance, daily goals, sleep tracking), it also supports HR sensors, offers a battery life of approx. 5 days and is waterproof ( 5 ATM). But what differentiates it from other bracelets is its ability to automatically record power port units and sets and deposit them as such in the app.Fitness bracelet with best battery life : Garmin Vivofit 4 ( our Vivofit 4 Review )The Vivofit series is known for its minimalist features and an outstanding battery life of about one year. If the battery is empty, it will be replaced with another battery. The Vivofit 4 mastered the basics of a good fitness bracelet: 24 × 7 activity recording (steps, calories, distance, daily goals, sleep tracking), waterproof (5 ATM), timer, stopwatch, easy to read display, reasonably priced.

Fitness trackers varies in terms of price and functionality. The best fitness tracker should be the one with the advanced features and matching what you need the most. If a fitness tracker can satisfy almost all of your needs, it is the best fitness tracker for you.
